title: lazy_lookup crash
body:
### Expected behaviour:

To run without a crash
### Actual behaviour:

It does crash
#### Config:

```
tasks:
  Series-NPO:
    npo_watchlist:
      email: 'xxxx@xxxxl.com'
      password: 'xxxxxxxxx'
      max_episode_age_days: 5
    plugin_priority:
      thetvdb_lookup: 500
      trakt_lookup: 250
    thetvdb_lookup:
      language: nl
    trakt_lookup:
      account: xxxxxxx
      username: xxxxxxxx
    accept_all: yes
    if:
      - "trakt_watched": reject
    exec:
      fail_entries: yes
      auto_escape: yes
      on_output:
        for_accepted:
          - download-npo xxxxxxxxxxxxxx
```
#### Log:

```

          username: '{{ secrets.trakt.usr }}'

title: --inject running non stop, without being called and on all tasks?
body:
- Flexget Version: 2.3.33
- Python Version:  2.7.9
- Installation method: virtualenv
- OS and version: Debian 8.6

Before **2016-09-23 11:22** you can see the normal behavior. --inject is called once every 5min up to multiple hours. At that date I stopped & upgraded flexget.  As you can see afterwards it runs 2-4 times per minute. Also seems it's accessing all other tasks in random, outside from the one it normally should. I don't remember till which version it worked normally, but when I saw this behavior was running  2.3.32, upgrading to 2.3.33 didn't change anything.

system('exec .psources/flexget/bin/flexget execute --tasks Horrible --inject "$title" "$link" >/dev/null 2>&1');

title: imdb_list: Login to IMDB does no work any longer
body:
### Expected behaviour:

Using the imdb_list plugin, retrieve movies on the watch list and the like.
### Actual behaviour:

Login to IMDB does not work, plugin returns "Login to IMDB failed. Check your credentials." despite credentials being correct, i.e., I am able to login with the credentials printed in the log output. I tried both variants for the username, i.e., for email foo@bar.com I tried the whole address as well as just "foo", neither worked.
### Steps to reproduce:

Setup a config file with the below snippet and run `flexget --debug --test execute`
#### Config:

```
tasks:
  populate_list:
    imdb_lookup: true
    accept_all: true
    imdb_list:
      list: watchlist
      login: <login email>
      password: <password>
    list_add:
      - movie_list: my_movies
```
#### Log:

```
2016-09-25 10:37 DEBUG    utils.requests populate_list   Fetching https://www.imdb.com/ap/signin?openid.return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.imdb.com%2Fap-signin-handler&openid.identity=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0%2Fidentifier_select&openid.assoc_handle=imdb_mobile_us&openid.mode=checkid_setup&openid.claimed_id=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0%2Fidentifier_select&openid.ns=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0
2016-09-25 10:37 DEBUG    imdb_list     populate_list   email=<login email>, password=<password>
2016-09-25 10:37 VERBOSE  utils.requests populate_list   Waiting 4.24 seconds until next request to imdb.com
2016-09-25 10:37 DEBUG    utils.requests populate_list   Fetching https://www.imdb.com/ap/signin/167-5712825-0663537?ie=UTF8&pf_rd_r=14YRHC25X2GR80X7EFC6&pf_rd_m=A2A1PIL045UJ9G&pf_rd_t=6301&pf_rd_i=imdb_mobile_us&pf_rd_p=2187562082&pf_rd_s=mobile-signin-slot
2016-09-25 10:37 VERBOSE  utils.requests populate_list   Waiting 4.79 seconds until next request to imdb.com
2016-09-25 10:37 DEBUG    utils.requests populate_list   Fetching http://www.imdb.com/profile
2016-09-25 10:37 CRITICAL plugin        populate_list   Login to IMDB failed. Check your credentials.

2016-09-25 10:37 DEBUG    task_queue                    task populate_list aborted: TaskAbort(reason=Login to IMDB failed. Check your credentials., silent=False)

title: AlphaRatio plugin bug?

### Actual behaviour:

body:

title: flexget seen search crashes when piping
body:
### Expected behaviour:

Get results of search piped to a file.
### Actual behaviour:

flexget crashes with "codec can't encode character error"
### Steps to reproduce:

flexget seen search 'pattern' | tee somefile
flexget seen search 'pattern' > somefile
#### Config:

No relevant config.
#### Log:

No log output is produced.
### Additional information:
- Flexget Version: 2.3.27.dev
- Python Version: 2.7.12
- Installation method: git
- OS and version: Linux Mint 17 Kernel 3.19.3-031903-lowlatency
- Link to crash log:

```
$ bin/flexget seen search 'tv_' | tee ~/work/test ; bin/flexget seen search 'tv_' --porcelain | tee ~/work/test ; bin/flexget seen search 'tv_' > ~/work/test ; bin/flexget seen search 'tv_' --porcelain > ~/work/test
Could not start manager: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\xf1' in position 1183797: ordinal not in range(128)
Could not start manager: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\xf1' in position 1182978: ordinal not in range(128)
Could not start manager: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\xf1' in position 1183797: ordinal not in range(128)
Could not start manager: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\xf1' in position 1182978: ordinal not in range(128)
```

The same results occur with `--porcelain`.

This appears to be related to #1223, but the fix there does not work. However, the following change does work. I don't know what problems this may cause though.

```
$ git diff
 diff --git a/flexget/terminal.py b/flexget/terminal.py
 index 22a819c..b3bb4d2 100644
 --- a/flexget/terminal.py
 +++ b/flexget/terminal.py
 @@ -257,6 +257,7 @@ def console(text, *args, **kwargs):
      try:
          print(text, *args, **kwargs)
      except UnicodeEncodeError:
 -        text = text.encode(io_encoding, 'replace').decode(io_encoding)
 +        #text = text.encode(io_encoding, 'replace').decode(io_encoding)
 +        text = text.encode(io_encoding, 'replace')
          print(text, *args, **kwargs)
      kwargs['file'].flush()  # flush to make sure the output is printed right away

```

title: console output no longer legible on narrow terminals or when piped
body:
### Expected behaviour:

Long field names should be truncated to fit on the terminal width. This was the previous behavior. Or the wrapping needs fixing. Also, the colorization should be disabled when piping the output (for example through `less`)
### Actual behaviour:

Titles or other field names can be very long and cause the line to wrap and then the pretty borders that are on by default wrap oddly making it hard to read the distorted table output. I usually use 80-wide terminals, but even on a 150-wide terminal this happens if the field names are long enough (and they often are). The long field name does get wrapped, but it's very oddly done and doesn't make full use of the terminal width and the table itself wraps when the terminal is <= 113 chars. Here's a screenshot of what happens on a 150-wide terminal when the longest title is 106 characters: http://i.imgur.com/J3mSmEZ.png

Also there is an issue when colorized output is piped through less. By default `less` uses displays control characters like ^A, so maybe all colorization should be disabled when piping output. If using `less -r` the output appears ok, but if using `less -R` there are display artifacts indicating that the colorization is using sequences other than the standard ANSI color escape sequences.
### Steps to reproduce:

With a terminal sized to 150-wide, and a downloaded title at 106 characters:
`flexget history`
`flexget history | less`
The colorization issue should be apparent when using:
`flexget history | less -r`
`flexget history | less -R`
- Flexget Version: 2.3.4
- Python Version: Python 2.7.12
- Installation method: git
- OS and version: OS X 10.11.6

title: Movie_list API movies sorting
body:
### Expected behaviour:

API sorts all movies from the list based on the sorted param, then limits the items to return.
### Actual behaviour:

API currently seems to get limited items from db (from page_size param), then applies the sorting,
resulting in correctly sorted movies, but only for the subset that was selected.
### Steps to reproduce:

Call the API to get movies from a list (/movies_list/{id}/movies) twice:
- First params:
  - page_size: 100 (just more than the total in your list)
- Second params:
  - page_size: 10 (just less than the total in your list)
#### Config:

No relevant config, having movies in a movie_list is enough.
#### Log:

First call: 
http://pastebin.com/SGzmY4fX

Second call: 
http://pastebin.com/e8XABzuw

As you can see, the results from the second call are different from the top f5 results from the first call.
### Additional information:
- Flexget Version: 2.2.22
- Python Version: 2.7.6
- Installation method: pip
- OS and version: Ubuntu Server 14.04
- Link to crash log: No crash

title: IMDb login fails
body:
### Expected behaviour:

imdb_list plugin logins in successfully with the logged in credentials.
### Actual behaviour:

Login fails.
### Steps to reproduce:
- Step 1: excute configuration
#### Config:

```
tasks:
  testtask:
    rss: <feed>
    imdb_lookup: yes
    list_match:
      from:
        - imdb_list:
            login: <username>
            password: <password
            list: watchlist
    download: <dir>
```
#### Log:

```
2016-08-08 20:26 VERBOSE utils.requests testtask Waiting 3.83 seconds until next request to imdb.com
2016-08-08 20:26 VERBOSE utils.requests testtask Waiting 4.66 seconds until next request to imdb.com
2016-08-08 20:26 CRITICAL plugin testtask Login to IMDB failed. Check your credentials.
2016-08-08 20:26 WARNING task testtask Aborting task (plugin: list_match)
```
### Additional information:

liiight advies to raise a ticket. Test was done by Krozer.
- Flexget Version: 2.2.13
- Python Version: 2.7.11
- Installation method: pip
- OS and version: Mac OS X 10.11.6
- Link to crash log:
### Test done by Krozer:

```
import re
import pprint

from flexget.utils.requests import Session as RequestSession, TimedLimiter
from requests.exceptions import RequestException
from flexget.utils.soup import get_soup
from flexget.plugin import PluginError


pp = pprint.PrettyPrinter(indent=4)
_session = RequestSession()
_session.add_domain_limiter(TimedLimiter('imdb.com', '5 seconds'))
_session.headers = {'Accept-Language': 'en-us'}

try:
    r = _session.get(
        'https://www.imdb.com/ap/signin?openid.return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.imdb.com%2Fap-signin-'
        'handler&openid.identity=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0%2Fidentifier_select&'
        'openid.assoc_handle=imdb_mobile_us&openid.mode=checkid_setup&openid.claimed_id=http%3A%'
        '2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0%2Fidentifier_select&openid.ns=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.ope'
        'nid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0')
except RequestException as e:
    raise PluginError(e.args[0])

soup = get_soup(r.content)
inputs = soup.select('form#ap_signin_form input')
data = dict((i['name'], i.get('value')) for i in inputs if i.get('name'))
action = soup.find('form', id='ap_signin_form').get('action')
pp.pprint(action)


data['email'] = <email>
data['password'] = <password>
print('email=%s, password=%s', data['email'], data['password'])


d = _session.post(action, data=data)
# Get user id by extracting from redirect url
r = _session.head('http://www.imdb.com/profile', allow_redirects=False)
pp.pprint(r.headers)
if not r.headers.get('location') or 'login' in r.headers['location']:
    raise PluginError('Login to IMDB failed. Check your credentials.')
user_id = re.search('ur\d+(?!\d)', r.headers['location']).group()
cookies = dict(d.cookies)
```

title: Search plugins storing BeautifulSoup objects in Entry cause excessive recursion in Entry::take_snapshot
body:
### Expected behaviour:

Flexget doesn't crash.
### Actual behaviour:

Flexget crashes due to excessive recursion depth while taking the snapshot of an entry produced by the TorrentLeech search plugin.
### Steps to reproduce:

Use the TorrentLeech search plugin in a task.
#### Config (snippet):

```
tasks:
  tv-discover:
    interval: 12 hours
    discover:
      what:
        - next_series_episodes: yes
      from:
        - torrentleech:
            rss_key: "{{ secrets.torrentleech.rsskey }}"
            username: "{{ secrets.torrentleech.username }}"
            password: "{{ secrets.torrentleech.password }}"
            category: Episodes HD
    transmission: yes
```
### Additional information:
- Flexget Version: 2.2.1
- Python Version: 2.7.12
- Installation method: pip
- OS and version: Fedora 24 x86_64
- Link to crash log: https://gist.github.com/danielkza/d6e8c98b31037de731c5b5ac76733b39
### Debugging information

I'm not familiar with the Flexget codebase, but some quick debugging shows the problem is caused by the TL plugin inserting some text directly from the HTML tree produced by BeautifulSoup. That text is actually a `bs4.element.NavigableString` that contains references to the whole tree, which Flexget attempts to serialize when saving a snapshot of the entry.

The plugin should convert any such usages to `unicode` before storing it in the entry. It is possible other search plugins have the same issue, so a generic solution might be desirable.

title: --cli-config only works in test mode
body:
### Expected behaviour:

Passing configuration parameters to `flexget execute` from the command line with `--cli-config` should work in normal (non-test) mode. The values passed through the command line should be replaced in the configuration variables the same way the are in test mode.
### Actual behaviour:

It works as expected as long as the `--test` flag is used. Without the `--test` flag variables in the configuration are not replaced by the values passed with `--cli-config`, instead, the literal variable name is used, i.e. `$variable`. 
### Steps to reproduce:
- Step 1: Using the minimal configuration below.
- Step 2: To observe correct behaviour execute in test mode: 

`flexget --test execute --tasks test --cli-config variable=foobar -v --dump`
- Step 3: To observe incorrect behaviour execute in normal mode:

`flexget execute --tasks test --cli-config variable=foobar -v --dump`
#### Config:

```
tasks:
  test:
    mock:
      - title: $variable
```
#### Log:
##### Test mode log:

The output is as expected. See how $variable is evaluated to 'foobar' in the entry title:

```
2016-07-28 10:27 INFO     manager                       Test mode, creating a copy from database ...
2016-07-28 10:27 INFO     manager                       Test database created
2016-07-28 10:27 VERBOSE  task_queue                    There are 1 tasks to execute. Shutdown will commence when they have completed.

title: Unicode issues with exec plugin
body:
Same as https://github.com/Flexget/Flexget/issues/1269, but with exec plugin

It was working well recently, but now if the given path contains unicode (e. g. "ñ") characters it crashes.

Running flexget version 2.1.23 installed using pip, on Windows 8.1 x64 + Python 2.7.12

Relevant snippet of crash report (crash_report.2016.07.25.115814396000.log): 

```
2016-07-25 11:58 CRITICAL task          remove-folders  BUG: Unhandled error in plugin exec: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\xf1' in position 124: ordinal not in range(128)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\flexget\task.py", line 444, in __run_plugin
    return method(*args, **kwargs)
  File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\flexget\event.py", line 23, in __call__
    return self.func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\flexget\plugins\output\exec.py", line 192, in phase_handler
    self.execute(task, 'on_' + phase, config)
  File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\flexget\plugins\output\exec.py", line 163, in execute
    if (self.execute_cmd(cmd, allow_background, config['encoding']) != 0 and
  File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\flexget\plugins\output\exec.py", line 109, in execute_cmd
    stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, close_fds=False)
  File "c:\python27\lib\subprocess.py", line 711, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "c:\python27\lib\subprocess.py", line 929, in _execute_child
    args = '{} /c "{}"'.format (comspec, args)
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\xf1' in position 124: ordinal not in range(128)
```

title: manual plugin setting not respected
body:
### Expected behaviour:

When set `manual: yes` any scheduled tasks containing it should be skipped.

Note: this use to work fine, it seems to have stopped when i upgraded to take advantage of the IRC daemon. This happens regardless of how many other tasks are scheduled.
### Actual behaviour:

Tasks are run by the daemon regardless of `manual` setting.
### Steps to reproduce:

Set scheduler to execute a task with `manual: yes` configured -> Task is processed.
#### Config:

```
tasks:      
  blk_gtv: &reuse_gtv
    template:
      - tvshows
      - transm_seedbox
      - tvdir
      - ratios
    set:
      addpaused: no
    disable: [ torrent_alive ]
    verify_ssl_certificates: no

  gettv_freshon:
    manual: yes
    <<: *reuse_gtv
    rss:
      url: "{{ secrets.rsss.freshon }}"
      group_links: yes
    headers:
      cookie: "{{ secrets.cookies.freshon }}"
    priority: 5

schedules:
  - tasks: [gettv_freshon]
    interval:
      minutes: 5
```

title: imdb_list is labeling tv series as movies.
body:
### Expected behaviour:

imdb_list setting series_name for a tv series.
### Actual behaviour:

imdb_list is setting everything to movie_name.
### Steps to reproduce:
- Step 1: ...
#### Config:

```
paste relevant config
use paste service if config is too long
```
#### Log:

```
2016-07-06 19:17 DEBUG    imdb_list     imdb_to_trakt_tv parsing line from csv: 1, tt2085059, Fri Jun  3 19:35:35 2016, Fri Jun  3 19:35:35 2016, , Black Mirror, TV Series, , , 8.8, 60, 2011, drama, sci_fi, thriller, 56397, 2011-12-04, http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2085059/
2016-07-06 19:17 TRACE    entry         imdb_to_trakt_tv ENTRY SET: imdb_name = u'Black Mirror'
2016-07-06 19:17 TRACE    entry         imdb_to_trakt_tv ENTRY SET: imdb_genres = [u'drama', u'sci_fi', u'thriller']
2016-07-06 19:17 TRACE    entry         imdb_to_trakt_tv ENTRY SET: movie_name = u'Black Mirror'
```

It looks like there is a "TV series" label in row 6 of the csv file from imdb to identify the type.

I think this is the code:

```
                entry = Entry({
                    'title': '%s (%s)' % (row[5], row[11]) if row[11] != '????' else '%s' % row[5],
                    'url': row[15],
                    'imdb_id': row[1],
                    'imdb_url': row[15],
                    'imdb_list_position': int(row[0]),
                    'imdb_list_created': datetime.strptime(row[2], '%a %b %d %H:%M:%S %Y') if row[2] else None,
                    'imdb_list_modified': datetime.strptime(row[3], '%a %b %d %H:%M:%S %Y') if row[3] else None,

title: RuntimeError: threads can only be started once
body:
### Expected behaviour:

While daemon running, I should still be able to run a manual execution.
### Actual behaviour:

It's seeing process is there but crashes because of Runtime error regards threads.
### Steps to reproduce:
- Step 1: start daemon `flexget daemon start -d`
- Step 2: run standard execution `flexget execute --verbose`
#### Log:

title: Unhandled error in plugin discover: cannot use a string pattern on a bytes-like object
body:
Unhandled error in plugin discover: cannot use a string pattern on a bytes-like object...
Issue appears when using discover with several search plugins and specified categories

Snippet of my discover plugin

```
discover:
      what:
        - emit_movie_queue: true
      from:
        - piratebay:
            category: "highres movies"
            sort_by: seeds
        - rarbg:
            category: [17, 44, 45, 42, 46]
        - torrentz: good
        - kat:
            category: movies

title: title_from (html plugin) no longer works with magnet links
body:
Since v2.0, title_from works incorrectly with magnet links when extracting links from html pages
### Expected behaviour:

title_from should produce a valid title for magnet links as it did with previous v1.x
### Actual behaviour:

title_from: title could not be determined for magnet links
### Steps to reproduce:
- Step 1: checking config

```
flexget -c sample.yml check
2016-06-25 16:15 VERBOSE  check                         Pre-checked 11 configuration lines
2016-06-25 16:15 VERBOSE  check                         Checking config file `/usr/local/scripts/flexget/sample.yml`
2016-06-25 16:15 VERBOSE  check                         Config passed check.
```

tasks:

title: t411 : Animation category
body:
### Expected behavior:

When searching for movies in "Animation" category with t411 plugins, it looks for a category beginning with "Animation" (as described in [wiki](http://flexget.com/wiki/Plugins/t411)).

The problem is that there is two categories beginning with Animation :
`Animation` (pid 455) and `Animation Série` (pid 637)

  animMulti:

title: Trakt_lookup not populating trakt_released field
body:
### Expected behaviour:

Trakt_lookup should populate the trakt_released field
### Actual behaviour:

The trakt_released field is always set to None for movies (haven't tested with series)
### Steps to reproduce:
- Step 1: Add a trakt_lookup in your config
- Step 2: Act on the trakt_released field (for example if statement, or echo)
#### Config:

```
FillMovieQueue:
    trakt_list:
      account: '{{ secrets.trakt.account }}'
      list: watchlist
      type: movies
    trakt_lookup: yes
    accept_all: yes
    exec:
      on_filter:
        for_entries:
          - echo "found {{ trakt_released }}"
```
#### Log:

```
2016-06-14 14:32 DEBUG exec FillMovieQueue phase_name: on_filter operation: for_entries cmd: echo "found None”
```
### Additional information:
- Flexget Version: 2.0.45
- Python Version: 2.7.6
- Installation method: Pip
- OS and version: Ubuntu 14.04
- Link to crash log: None

### Actual behaviour:

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    rv = self.handle_user_exception(e)

Sending an illegal value to that format causes a crash

title: Newznab plugin series search not working
body:
### Expected behaviour:

Episodes should be found, and using the same config with torrents as input and output they are found. (Episode nzb's are available when doing a manual search)
### Actual behaviour:

An error is logged and nothing is found
### Steps to reproduce:

Use the newznab plugin to search for series (I tested with nzbgeek)
#### Config:

```
 series search usenet:
    domain_delay:
      api.nzbgeek.info: 3 seconds
    priority: 14
    thetvdb_lookup: yes
    trakt_lookup: yes
    seen: local
    accept_all: yes    
    template:
      - pushbullet-template       
      - sabnzbd-series-template
    configure_series:
      settings:
        identified_by: ep
        timeframe: 16 hours
        target: 1080p
        quality: 720p-1080p
      from:
        thetvdb_favorites:
          username: XXXXX
          account_id: XXXXXXXX       
    discover:
      what:
        - emit_series:
            from_start: yes
            backfill: yes
      from:
        - newznab:
            website: "https://api.nzbgeek.info/"
            apikey: "XXXXXXXX"
            category: tv
    interval: 1 hour
    exists_series:
      - /mnt/user/Series/
```
#### Log:

search usenet tvrage lookup support is gone, someone needs to update this plugin!
### Additional information:
- Flexget Version: 2.0.31
- Python Version: 2.7.11
- Installation method: PIP
- OS and version: Arch linux in docker on Unraid (Kernel 4.4.6-unRAID)
- Link to crash log:

title: API calls trailing slash
body:
### Expected behaviour:

All the API calls should use the same url structure, more specifically all should have a trailing slash in the request.
### Actual behaviour:

Some API calls return a 404 error when used with a trailing slash.
Some calls can be seen from the UI, in the Swagger API docs there are some endpoints without trailing slashes as well, not all are tested but they do correspond to the ones used in the UI
### Steps to reproduce:
1. Enable API in the config
2. Request one of the following endpoints:
   - `/api/series/search/{ name }/` (GET)
   - `/api/series/{ show_id }/` (DELETE, GET, PUT)
   - `/api/series/{ show_id }/episodes/` (DELETE, GET)
   - `/api/series/{ show_id }/episodes/{ ep_id }/` (DELETE, GET)
   - `/api/series/{ show_id }/episodes/{ ep_id }/releases/` (DELETE, GET, PUT)
#### Config:

Basic API enabling config is enough to reproduce
#### Log:

There is no crash log or relevant log available, only the returned message from the server when trying to access some endpoints with the trailing slash

```
{
  "message": "The requested URL was not found on the server.  If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again. You have requested this URI [/series/search/iZombie/] but did you mean /series/search/<string:name> ?"
}
```
### Additional information:
- Flexget Version: v2.0.37.dev
- Python Version: 2.7.10
- Installation method: Git
- OS and version: Windows 10, 64-bit

Used working config.(which was working in previous setup,i.e newer to 1 week backup).

  HorribleSubs:

title: rottentomatoes_list not produceing entries
body:
```
tasks:
  Rottentomatoes_DVDs:
    rottentomatoes_list:
      api_key: '{{ secrets.rottentomatoes.api }}'
      dvds:
        - new_releases
        - top_rentals
        - current_releases
    accept_all: yes
```

this task doesn't produce anything.

digging around in the code i believe the problem is line 57 of rottentomatoes_list.py

```
            if type(l_names) is not list: 
                continue
```

this always evaluates to true and all the l_names items hit the continue statement breaking out of the parent for loop.
i tried :

```
            if type(l_names) is not list:
                log.warning('type(%s) is not list, its %s, continuing' % (l_names, type(l_names))) 
                continue
```

and got this :

`WARNING  rottentomatoes_list Rottentomatoes_DVDs type([u'new_releases']) is not list, its <type 'list'>, continuing`

I gather this bit of code is trying to skip the api_key. For now I'm replacing line 57 with:
`if l_type == 'api_key'`
hacky and defiantly not defensive programing, but it works for me.

title: list_remove fails with imdb_list on certain movies
body:
```
2016-05-12 01:18 VERBOSE  utils.requests MYTASKNAME Waiting 4.89 seconds until next request to imdb.com
2016-05-12 01:18 CRITICAL task          MYTASKNAME BUG: Unhandled error in plugin list_remove: 400 Client Error: Bad Request for url: http://www.imdb.com/list/_ajax/watchlist_has
2016-05-12 01:18 CRITICAL manager       MYTASKNAME An unexpected crash has occurred. Writing crash report to {{CRASH_REPORT_LOCATION}}. Please verify you are running the latest version of flexget by using "flexget -V" from CLI or by using version_checker plugin at http://flexget.com/wiki/Plugins/version_checker. You are currently using version 2.0.19
2016-05-12 01:18 WARNING  task          MYTASKNAME Aborting task (plugin: list_remove)
```

The plugin seems to be crashing consistently on certain movie names.  When I remove one offending movie name from the search, it will crash consistently on another after several successful lookups of other movie names.  I suspect the task is crashing on values which it cannot locate in IMDB.  Examples of offending values are "7 Days in Hell (2015)", "Batman Under the Red Hood (2010)" and "Batman Apocalypse (2010)".

title: FTP input plugin improvement suggestions
body:
Findings and suggestions after testing https://github.com/Flexget/Flexget/pull/1161
as discussed with @liiight 

Test config:

```
tasks:
  ftpauto:
    ftp_list:
      username: user
      password: 'a password'
      host: someip
      port: someport
      retrieve: dirs
      use_ssl: yes
      dirs: ./test/
      regex: pal
    series:
      - Girls
    download: C:\Users\Administrator\Desktop\autodl\complete
```

1) Plugin iterates over everything, making it slow to progress 1000 directories.
http://pastebin.com/gg7mPisy

Using the following in dirs property returns above.
./test/
/test/
test

2) Doesn't check/validate valid/invalid properties

3)  Suggest adding a recursion flag to define how many subdirectories should be processed

4) When using dirs, it should only look into the directories defined in config.

title: SSLError: bad handshake

Flexget Version 2.0.16
Python Version 2.7.3

Flexget executed with:

flexget -L debug execute --tasks clean-movie-queue --dump --now
```

Config:

```
##### Remove manually movies downloaded from the movie queue and trakt list
#
  clean-movie-queue:
    priority: 11
    interval: 2 hour
    verify_ssl_certificates: no
    template:
      - disable-seen-retry
      - movies-metainfo
    filesystem:
      path: '{{secrets.folders.root}}{{secrets.folders.movies}}'
      recursive: yes
      retrieve: files
      regexp: '.*\.(avi|mkv|mp4)$'
    accept_all: yes
    list_remove:
      - movie_list: trakt-movies
      - trakt_list:

While using Flexget version 1.2.521 never had problems with rTorrent.
In config.yml I use this:

`uri: scgi://127.0.0.1:4632`

Today I updated Flexget to latest version  2.0.15.

And I have this error

`016-05-09 09:37 CRITICAL plugin        DELETE-RATIO    Couldn't connect to rTorrent: Int or String expected`

Is it possible to be a bug? Or some configuration I let it pass?

title: API inject not passing the --now switch

body:

  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/flexget/task.py", line 438, in __run_plugin
    return method(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/flexget/event.py", line 22, in __call__

  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/flexget/plugins/filter/list_reject.py", line 33, in on_task_filter
    if entry in thelist:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/flexget/plugins/list/imdb_list.py", line 148, in __contains__
    return any(e['imdb_id'] == entry['imdb_id'] for e in self.items)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/flexget/plugins/list/imdb_list.py", line 103, in items

HTTPError: 404 Client Error: Not Found for url: http://www.imdb.com/list/export?list_id=ratings&author_id=ur1250180

body:
**Version**

flexget -V
2.0.8
You are on the latest release.
```

**config.yml snippet**

```
  get_series:
    priority: 6
    #verify_ssl_certificates: no
    configure_series:
      settings:
        #quality: 720p hdtv+
        timeframe: 6 hours
        target: 720p hdtv
        identified_by: ep
        exact: yes
      from:
        trakt_list:
          username: '{{ secrets.trakt.username }}'
          account: '{{ secrets.trakt.account }}'
          list: 1-b-shows-b-follow
          type: shows
          #strip_dates: yes
        #listdir:
          #- /volume1/Disk1/Library/TV Shows
    #template: download-show
    template:
      - get_series_standards
      - download-show
```

**template snippets**

```
  get_series_standards:
    domain_delay:
      sceneaccess.eu: 8 seconds
      sceneaccess.org: 8 seconds
    #verify_ssl_certificates: no
    content_size:
      max: 5000
      min: 60
    regexp:
      reject:
        - FASTSUB #French
        - VOSTFR #French
        - Subtitulado #Spanish
        - Special-Wicked #Special trailer episodes from Once Upon a Time
        - Magazine #No magazines on Arrow, thank you.
        - NLsubs
    content_filter:
      reject:
        - '*.avi' #Uhgg Jak!
```

```
  download-show:
    #verify_ssl_certificates: no
    discover:
      what:
        - emit_series: yes
            #from_start: yes backfill: no
      from:
        - sceneaccess:
            username: '{{ secrets.sceneaccess.username }}'
            password: '{{ secrets.sceneaccess.password }}'
            gravity_multiplier: 200
            category:

                - TV/HD-x264
      release_estimations: strict #only download those with air dates

title: TVMaze estimator (and lookup) does not always return the expected date/id
body:
Log snippet: http://pastebin.com/raw/UB44hDWR

Sometimes, for some inexplicable reason, TVMaze lookup caches wrong data eg. an episode from a different show, which results in a wrong release estimation.

The log snippet shows that S04E02 of Inside Amy Schumer has id 721019 but that is incorrect as it is in fact S04E03.

I have been unable to reproduce it. It happens randomly. The config used is a basic `emit_series` with `discover`.

title: Transmission 2.90+ issue
body:
Hi to all.

Flexget version is 2.0.2.
Python version is 3.4.2.
And python3-transmissionrpc (0.11-2)

My config worked great with transmission 2.84
I have installed transmission 2.92 and now I get errors in my log
`TransmissionError: Query failed with result "download directory path is not absolute".`

In transmission's changelog I found 

> Transmission 2.90 (2016/02/28)
> All Platforms
> ...
> Require absolute paths in RPC requests
> ...

There is nothing about it in [rpc-spec](https://trac.transmissionbt.com/browser/tags/2.92/extras/rpc-spec.txt).
And nothing in [transmissionrpc 0.11 Release notes](https://bitbucket.org/blueluna/transmissionrpc/wiki/releasenotes/0.11)

But may be it's relative to [this](https://bitbucket.org/blueluna/transmissionrpc/issues/81/py3-typeerror-endswith-first-arg-must-be) and [this](https://github.com/Flexget/Flexget/issues/1066)

And there are a lot of people who complain. As [example](https://forum.transmissionbt.com/viewtopic.php?t=17884). And it seems like someone [solved the problem](https://github.com/SickRage/sickrage-issues/issues/1071)

Is there a way to fix it?

title: shows API incorrect sorting
body:
Sorting in now done after the limit selection on the db, which results in incorrect sorting orders.
Correct should be to order all the shows first and then select the first ones based on the limit.

Created this issue as a reminder for @liiight :D

title: BUG: Unhandled error in plugin rss: u'url'
body:
Hi,
I get an error while using the rss plugin:

> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flexget/task.py", line 438, in __run_plugin
>     return method(_args, *_kwargs)

>     response = func(_args, *_kwargs)

>     return func(_args, *_kwargs)
>   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flexget/plugins/input/rss.py", line 448, in on_task_input
>     e.setdefault('urls', [e['url']]).extend(
>   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flexget/utils/lazy_dict.py", line 69, in __getitem__
>     item = self.store[key]
> KeyError: u'url'

I am generating local xml files and use them as the rss source, since the original rss feed is a mess.
The items with one direct link look like this:

```
    <item>
        <title>London Has Fallen 2016 720p xxxxxxxxxx</title>
        <link>http://uplxxxxx.net/file/xxxxxxxxxx/London.Has.Fallen.2016.720.xxxxxxxxxx.mkv</link>
    </item>
```

and with several parts like this:

```
    <item>
        <title>The Revenant 2015 720p xxxxxxxxxxx</title>
        <link>http://uplxxxxx.net/file/xxxxxxxxxx/The.Revenant.2015.720-xxxxxxxxxx.part01.rar</link>
        <enclosure url="http://uplxxxxx.net/file/xxxxxxxxxx/The.Revenant.2015.720-xxxxxxxxxx.part02.rar" />
        <enclosure url="http://uplxxxxx.net/file/xxxxxxxxxx/The.Revenant.2015.720-xxxxxxxxxx.part03.rar" />
        <enclosure url="http://uplxxxxx.net/file/xxxxxxxxxx/The.Revenant.2015.720-xxxxxxxxxx.part04.rar" />
        <enclosure url="http://uplxxxxx.net/file/xxxxxxxxxx/The.Revenant.2015.720-xxxxxxxxxx.part05.rar" />
        <enclosure url="http://uplxxxxx.net/file/xxxxxxxxxx/The.Revenant.2015.720-xxxxxxxxxx.part06.rar" />
        <enclosure url="http://uplxxxxx.net/file/xxxxxxxxxx/The.Revenant.2015.720-xxxxxxxxxx.part07.rar" />
        <enclosure url="http://uplxxxxx.net/file/xxxxxxxxxx/The.Revenant.2015.720-xxxxxxxxxx.part08.rar" />
    </item>
```

And finally this is the rss configuration:

> ```
> rss:
>   url: file:///volume1/homes/admin/movies_720p_feed.xml
>   group_links: yes
> ```

It looks like the rss parser does not set e['url'] with this setting. Since 'link' is not set at all in the config and there are unequal 1 enclosures (zero or more than 1), rss should set e['url'] in line 433.

Any suggestions?

title: List_queue bug with multiple movies
body:
If there are multiple movies present in the movie_list and you use list_queue to make sure only 1 copy gets downloaded, the amount of accepted entries will be equal to the amount of movies in your list, but the movies are not all correct. It will download some movies multiple times, and other not at all.

log:

```

title: List_accept multiple downloads
body:
The list_accept plugin accepts all entries (that have not been previously rejected), which results in the same movie being downloaded. This should probably only accept the first entry.

Updating from `movie_queue:accept` will not break your config this way, but it will make your downloads skyrocket ;) 

Config:

```
DownloadMovies:
    tmdb_lookup: yes
    require_field:
      - tmdb_name
      - tmdb_year
    quality: <=720p hdrip+
    discover:
      interval: 3 hour
      what:
        - movie_list: Looking
      from:
        - kat:
            verified: yes
        - torrentz: verified
    list_accept:
      - movie_list: Looking
    sort_by: quality
    set:
      path: "/PlexMediaServer/Downloading/Movies/{{ tmdb_name }} ({{ tmdb_year }})"
      content_filename: "{{ tmdb_name }} ({{ tmdb_year }})”
```

```

title: WebUI: log login attempts, HTTP error codes, to be able to make it secure using fail2ban
body:
I'm using fail2ban to protect myself from SSH bruteforce, and SSH DDOS attacks - this was my only service I used over WAN, and it could be easily changed with Flexget's new WebUI!

The WebUI should log to an other file, like `~/.flexget/webui.log`. Later I'll create a full regexp to the possible failures, in this format [filter.d/apache-auth.conf](https://github.com/fail2ban/fail2ban/blob/master/config/filter.d/apache-auth.conf#L13).

Thanks @stevezau!

flexget.options.ParserError

title: APScheduler exception causes flexget to no longer run in daemon mode
body:
I'm not entirely sure if this is an issue for flexget, or if it's something that the APScheduler program should address, but I have noticed for some time that while running flexget through an UpStart daemon on Ubuntu (currently version 14.04), it will stop running tasks. I am needing to then restart the daemon (sudo restart flexget) which gets it working again for some time. Sometimes it will continue working for days, other times I will need to restart it multiple times throughout the day. After digging around, I found the following exception in the UpStart log file (/var/log/upstart/flexget.log), which does not appear in the ~/.flexget/flexget.log file. Every time flexget stops working recently with the scheduler, this exception has shown up in the log file. I have not noticed any other indications that it has stopped working. It appears to finish the current set of tasks that were triggered, but no further tasks will run after this.

title: Series/template caching?
body:
Hi

As a result of my investigation:
http://discuss.flexget.com/t/does-flexget-cache-the-templates-in-the-config-file/1607/2

In short:
Adding a new tvshow to series in config file and using emit_series with from_start does not emit the new tvshow. A combination of both begin setting and from_start also does not work.

Setting the begin episode in the config and removing the option from_start works. Using the cli to set the begin episode also works (while still using both the begin setting in the config and from_start option).

title: TMDB error back (not critical), isolated and in a new exciting variety ("New instance conflicts with persistent instance")
body:
If I could just disable TMDB lookups I would, but apparently setting either "disable: tmdb_lookup" or setting "tmdb_lookup: no", or both at the same time, even in the same template, still calls TMDB lookups. This is nothing compared to the previous errors that crashed multiple times per task, this just fails once per hour on a specific task and might even be local. Just thought I'd report it for posterity. Have not tested against empty DB yet but tested with latest (1.2.481).

title: error when using both secrets and exec plugins
body:
I was trying to use `{{now|formatdate("%Y%m%d")}}` inside a call to exec, but was getting failures indicating the entry did not have the required fields for string replacement. I narrowed it down to the use a the secrets plugin, even if the secrets file is empty. The following task demonstrates that 
with secrets the output is `Stdout: <function now at 0x10f9a5320>` but without it you get the expected answer: `Stdout: 20160224`

```
secrets: secrets.yml
tasks:
  test2:
    manual: yes
    disable:
      - seen
      - download
      - backlog
    html:
      url: http://flexget.com/wiki/Plugins
    limit_new: 1
    accept_all: yes
    exec:
      on_output:
        for_accepted:
          - echo "{{now|formatdate("%Y%m%d")}}"
      fail_entries: true
```

# flexget --version
1.2.459.dev

make_rss tags an RSS entry title with " - (Render Error)" for downloads that use TheTVDB as a lookup.
Entries that use IMDB lookup seem fine.
Expecting a full RSS entry built up from the appropriate TheTVDB entry.

Config:

```
templates:
  rss_feed:
    make_rss:
      file: '<redacted>/feed.xml'
      days: -1
      items: 10
      link:
        - imdb_url

  eztv-rss:
    template:
...
      - rss_feed
    rss:
      url: 'https://eztv.ag/ezrss.xml'
    configure_series:
...
    thetvdb_lookup: yes
```

Log:

```
Error while rendering entry <Entry(title=<redacted tv episode>,state=accepted)>, falling back to plain title: (TypeError) 'NoneType' object is not iterable
```

title: Webui and API security issues
body:
1. Webui always automatically generates the default flexget/flexget user, even when explicitly removed, this is just plain idiotic. Especially since all the examples open the webui to the public internet (listen port defined as 0.0.0.0)
2. It's impossible to see said user being added as there is no `flexget users list` anymore

Fix proposal:
1. DON'T AUTOGENERATE THE DEFAULT USER. Thank you. Typing `flexget users add <username> <password>` isn't that much of a hassle for the extra security.
2. (re-)add the list -command, or make it clear that there is only one user account for webui.

title: Series not deleted in DB after removal from trakt list
body:
Hi,

I removed a series ("Last Week Tonight with John Oliver") from my trakt watchlist last week, but it's still mentioned in the database (running `flexget series list`). Additionally, Flex isn't searching for the show (it doesn't appear in any logs).
- Adding new shows to Trakt updates Flex's DB fine.
- Re-adding the show doesn't cause it to be searched.
- I've tried removing it using `flexget series forget "Last Week Tonight with John Oliver (2013)"` which works fine for other shows, but not this.
- I've used --no-cache too.

Is there another command to remove it manually from the DB, or do I have to dig inside with a shovel? It's a weird bug; never come across it before.

Will

```
configure_series:
      from:
        trakt_list:
          username: a
          list: watchlist
          type: shows
      settings:
        timeframe: 2 hours
        target: 720p
        identified_by: ep
```

title: Movie queue API crash on invalid quality
body:
When trying to add or edit an existing movie, and using an invalid requirement in the body, a validation error should be raised. but instead there is a crash

Example: 
`curl -X PUT --header "Content-Type: application/json" --header "Accept: application/json" -d "{\"quality\": \"string\"}" "http://127.0.0.1:5050/api/movie_queue/1/"`

Crash:
http://pastebin.com/sWp5WMi3

title: Daemon hangs on apscheduler error
body:
Daemon appears to sometimes hang on apscheduler error:

`2016-02-01 13:03 WARNING  apscheduler.scheduler                 Execution of job "scan* (trigger: interval[0:05:00], next run at: 2016-02-01 13:03:50 IST)" skipped: maximum number of running instances reached (1)`

Even weirder, when running daemon in the foreground and hitting any key on that error, daemon operation seems to pick up again.

title: exists_movie plugin not working
body:
I recently built a new flexget database and now when I execute my config, it wants to download every movie on my trakt watchlist. I already have most of these movies. I tried to implement the exist_movies plugin, but it has no effect on the outcome.

Here is my config:

```
  secrets: secretfile.yml

  tasks:
    get_series:
      priority: 1
      transmission:
        username: '{{ secrets.trans.usr }}'
        password: '{{ secrets.trans.pwd }}'
        main_file_only: yes
        path: '/media/Media/Torrents/Downloads/Shows/{{ series_name }}'
      content_filter:
        reject: '*.rar'
      content_size:
        max: 800
      regexp:
        reject_excluding:
          - ettv|eztv|rartv|PublicHD
      exists_series: '/media/Media/Shows/'

         - Pretty Little Liars

title: Error during input plugin rss: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xa0 in position 2687
body:
I have a Raspberry Pi running Raspbian Jessie:

```
pi@RaspberryPi:~ $ uname -a
Linux RaspberryPi 4.1.13-v7+ #826 SMP PREEMPT Fri Nov 13 20:19:03 GMT 2015 armv7l GNU/Linux
pi@RaspberryPi:~ $ python
Python 2.7.9 (default, Mar  8 2015, 00:52:26) 
[GCC 4.9.2] on linux2
```

I installed flexget by running

```
sudo apt-get install python-dev python-pip
sudo pip install flexget
sudo pip install transmissionrpc
```

and created `~/.flexget/config.yml` with the following contents:

```
templates:
  show_list:
    series:
      settings:
        shows:
          timeframe: 24 hours
          target: 720p+ h264
      shows:
        - 8 Out of 10 Cats
        - 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

tasks:
  good_HDTV:
    priority: 20
    template: show_list
    inputs:
      - rss:
          url: http://kat.cr/usearch/8%20out%20of%2010%20cats%20user%3Astateofmind80%20category%3Atv/?rss=1
          other_fields: ['torrent:magnetURI']
          link: 'torrent:magnetURI'
    magnets: yes
    transmission: yes
```

When I run `flexget execute`, I get the following output.

```
pi@RaspberryPi:~ $ flexget execute
2016-01-28 23:07 VERBOSE  task_queue                    There are 1 tasks to execute. Shutdown will commence when they have completed.
2016-01-28 23:07 WARNING  inputs        good_HDTV       Error during input plugin rss: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xa0 in position 2687: ordinal not in range(128)
2016-01-28 23:07 WARNING  details       good_HDTV       Task didn't produce any entries. This is likely due to a mis-configured or non-functional input.
2016-01-28 23:07 VERBOSE  series        good_HDTV       Auto enabling exact matching for series 8 Out of 10 Cats (reason 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown)
2016-01-28 23:07 VERBOSE  details       good_HDTV       Summary - Accepted: 0 (Rejected: 0 Undecided: 0 Failed: 0)
```

I wrote the `config.yml` file in `nano` in the shell, and it isn't long enough for there to be a position 2687, so it can't be an issue with unicode in my config file.

For more context, I also looked at the contents of `/etc/default/locale`, which are

```
#  File generated by update-locale
LANG=en_GB.UTF-8
```

Why is this problem happening, and how do I stop it? Are there any error logs I can copy and paste here?

title: Subliminal plugin unusable
body:
Subliminal has a requirement of `guessit<2.0,>=0.9.1`, Flexget requires `guessit>=2.0rc5`

It's tedious to get both working at the same time, since installing subliminal will uninstall the later version of guessit required by flesxget.

title: Deluge plugin, regression with main_file_only
body:
Recently I updated my older FlexGet install to try and solve an unrelated issue (which didn't work anyway). Over the last few weeks I started noticing my previously working setup suddenly not working (files being kept inside their folders instead of being moved to the parent, with another plugin in Deluge to remove the remains on torrent removal). After much searching I came across #489, I have to admit I was pretty shocked to find this was actually a "fix" to something that wasn't broken as far as I was aware and has now removed functionality that was crucial in my setup.

Currently I have no way of working around this "fix". I tried to remove and roll back to 1.2.303 (presumably the last version of FlexGet before this was locked in) but apparently that breaks unknown dependency chains throughout its plugins and I have no way of working out which pip packages to remove to fix it (I don't want to hose my database in the process, but don't have much choice and to be honest would prefer to have a blank slate than to have what is effectively a crippled plugin in my case). There appears to be no plugin in Deluge to handle this use case. In an attempt to roll my own solution, I can't seem to get the Deluge Web JSON API plugin to work (500 errors when accessing the /json address), and I can't find any decent documentation on actually HOW to aces the Deluge RPC API in any other way. I thought I could write a bash script to work around the problem but using Deluge's console UI doesn't provide enough information to differentiate between different torrents (even labels would be nice, but a feature request from 5 years ago suggests this isn't going to happen anytime soon). I'm not even going to attempt to make a Deluge plugin because their documentation is a total mess and I have no idea where to start.

Assuming this "fix" is the desired behaviour, there needs to be a configuration option to go back to the old behaviour, i.e. get the main file and move it to the root alongside its parent folder, and rename the parent folder so it's hidden.

title: Movie queue will add anything that is sent to it
body:
Movie queue will add anything that is sent to it, even if IMDB and TMDB lookup fails.

```
2015-12-23 11:44 DEBUG    imdb_lookup                   No title passed. Lookup for tt2937686
2015-12-23 11:44 VERBOSE  imdb_lookup                   Parsing imdb for ``
2015-12-23 11:44 DEBUG    requests                      Fetching http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2937686/
2015-12-23 11:44 DEBUG    plugin                        decorator caught RequestException. handled traceback:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Flexget\flexget\plugin.py", line 124, in wrapped_func
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Flexget\flexget\utils\database.py", line 30, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Flexget\flexget\plugins\metainfo\imdb_lookup.py", line 374, in lookup
    movie = self._parse_new_movie(entry['imdb_url'], session)
  File "C:\Flexget\flexget\plugins\metainfo\imdb_lookup.py", line 405, in _parse_new_movie
    parser.parse(imdb_url)
  File "C:\Flexget\flexget\utils\imdb.py", line 233, in parse
    page = requests.get(url)
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\requests\sessions.py", line 480, in get
    return self.request('GET', url, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Flexget\flexget\utils\requests.py", line 160, in request
    result.raise_for_status()
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\requests\models.py", line 837, in raise_for_status
    raise HTTPError(http_error_msg, response=self)
HTTPError: 404 Client Error: Not Found for url: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2937686/
2015-12-23 11:44 INFO     imdb_lookup                   Requestexception: 404 client error: not found for url: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2937686/
2015-12-23 11:44 WARNING  tmdb_lookup                   TMDB lookup failed for 
2015-12-23 11:44 INFO     movie_queue                   Adding None to movie queue with quality=any.
```

I'm not sure where to handle this @gazpachoking. I can check in queue_add if a result was return instead of None but should we even use that log_once instead of raising the exception?
https://github.com/Flexget/Flexget/blob/develop/flexget/plugins/metainfo/imdb_lookup.py#L237

This might not have been an issue so far but if expose movie_queue to the API we need to verify input better.

title: url_title field is not being sent to Pushover
body: url_title field is not being sent to Pushover. This is due to a refactor in Pushover plugin that directlyuses config elements in the request sent to Pushover. Pushover API expect `url_title` and we send it `urltitle`.

body:
with the update to 1.2.408 some imdb tables were truncated
the link table between movies and genres (imdb_movie_genres) wasnt
I'm now getting movies rejected by reject_genres because the movie id's are being reused
ie.
The movie with id 40 was a musical (and rejected by my config) 
update to 1.2.408, movies table is truncated
A new movie (not a musical) gets inserted with id 40 and its genres are added to imdb_movie_genres
movie 40 is filtered by by the config due to movie 40 appearing to be a musical

looks like imdb_movie_actors, imdb_movie_directors, imdb_movie_genres and imdb_movie_languages should have all been truncated also
mh

title: Crash with discover and TVMaze
body:
Hi, there is an issue in latest version (1.2.400) with the discover plugin and TVMaze, here is the error: http://pastie.org/10606946
There is a workaround, you need to add `ignore_estimations: yes` to your discover plugin configuration.

If you need anything to help solving this I'm willing to help!

title: TVMaze estimator causes socket issues
body: Multiple requests in quick succession can cause a socket error with urrlib2. This need to be handled both on pytvmaze side and on our side after a new exception will be raised.

title: Flexget Rtorrent plugin does not support local socket file
body:
Hi,

according to the documention, the rtorrent plugin should support a local socket file:

Name    Info    Description
uri Text    rTorrent URI. IE: scgi://localhost:5000, ​http://localhost:80/RPC2, **/home/rtorrent/rtorrent.sock**

Unfortunately this is not working, mainly because of:

```
        # Determine the proxy server
        if parsed_uri.scheme in ['http', 'https']:
            sp = HTTPServerProxy
        elif parsed_uri.scheme == 'scgi':
            sp = SCGIServerProxy
        else:
            raise IOError('Unsupported scheme %s for uri %s' % (parsed_uri.scheme, self.uri))
```

Here there is no support of a local socket as the parsed_uri.scheme will be empty in case of using local file and then the plugin will raise the Unsupported scheme error message

Thanks,
kouze

title: Flexget keeps redownloading the same 2 episodes
body:
This happened once in the past, and I had to reset my database to fix it. Now it started happening again to these 2 episodes:

```
2015-11-25 14:16 VERBOSE  input_cache   Get tvshows hdtv <720p Restored 3 entries from db cache
2015-11-25 14:16 VERBOSE  input_cache   Get tvshows hdtv <720p Restored 20 entries from cache
2015-11-25 14:16 VERBOSE  input_cache   Get tvshows hdtv <720p Restored 50 entries from cache
2015-11-25 14:16 VERBOSE  input_cache   Get tvshows hdtv <720p Restored 25 entries from cache
2015-11-25 14:16 VERBOSE  details       Get tvshows hdtv <720p Produced 95 entries.
2015-11-25 14:16 VERBOSE  task          Get tvshows hdtv <720p ACCEPTED: `The Big Bang Theory 9x09 The Platonic Permutation 720p` by series plugin because target quality
2015-11-25 14:16 VERBOSE  task          Get tvshows hdtv <720p REJECTED: `Family Guy 14x06 A Shot in the Dark 720p` by series plugin because episode has already been downloaded
2015-11-25 14:16 VERBOSE  task          Get tvshows hdtv <720p ACCEPTED: `Family Guy 14x07 Peter’s Sister 720p` by series plugin because target quality
2015-11-25 14:17 VERBOSE  parser_internal Get tvshows hdtv <720p Title `The Big Bang Theory` looks like series `The Big Bang Theory (2007)` but cannot find any series numbering.
2015-11-25 14:17 VERBOSE  parser_internal Get tvshows hdtv <720p Title `Family Guy` looks like series `Family Guy (1999)` but cannot find any series numbering.
2015-11-25 14:17 VERBOSE  details       Get tvshows hdtv <720p Summary - Accepted: 2 (Rejected: 4 Undecided: 89 Failed: 0)
2015-11-25 14:17 INFO     transmission  Get tvshows hdtv <720p "Family Guy 14x07 Peter’s Sister 720p" torrent added to transmission
2015-11-25 14:17 INFO     transmission  Get tvshows hdtv <720p "The Big Bang Theory 9x09 The Platonic Permutation 720p" torrent added to transmission
2015-11-25 14:17 VERBOSE  transmission  Get tvshows hdtv <720p Torrent "Family+Guy+S14E07+720p+HDTV+x264+0SEC": status: "downloading" - ratio: -1.0 -  date added: 2015-11-25 14:17:04 - date done: 1969-12-31 21:00:00
2015-11-25 14:17 VERBOSE  transmission  Get tvshows hdtv <720p Torrent "The+Big+Bang+Theory+S09E09+720p+HDTV+X264+DIMENSION": status: "downloading" - ratio: -1.0 -  date added: 2015-11-25 14:17:04 - date done: 1969-12-31 21:00:00
```

No matter how many times I run `flexget execute` the same 2 episodes will be accepted and added to transmission.

I don't know if the problem is one or all of the above:
- series_exists is not detecting those episodes as already downloaded
- seen is not detecting that those episodes have already been seen
- parser_internal is not being able to parse those episodes for some reason so everything else fails.

Any idea what's going on? Thank you very much.
